intro: Trichodesma marsabiticum, commonly known as the Marsabit trichodesma, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Kenya. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in rocky and well-drained soils, often found in mountainous areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
